item.title: Bipartite Exponential Random Graph Models
item.description: Introduction We have already discussed a lot about Exponential Random Graph Models (ERGMs) in the first tutorial. However, thereâ€™s much more to learn! Many times, researchers would like to run ERGMs for network datasets that are not binary, and determine how complex variables influence the probability of a network connection. For example, additional methods exist for using ERGMs with networks that have bipartite (two-mode) data and longitudinal (dynamic networks across time) data.
